results.title: Chi: the breath of life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Healers quacks or mystics”.
In this episode, Nevill Drury visits the Oki East-West Centre to investigate disciplines which draw on eastern thought and philosophy for new directions in health care. “Chi” is the Chinese word for breath of life, an inner energy. The Chinese believe it is the source of remarkable power, so the ability to control this energy is vital for a healthy and happy life. In a healthy person, the “Chi” flows smoothly, integrating body, mind and spirit, but in an unwell person there are blockages, or imbalances. The techniques demonstrated include Oki Yoga, Tai Chi, Shiatsu (with Bruce Gyngell as the patient), macrobiotics and acupuncture.

results.title: Healers quacks or mystics
results.creator_credit: Richard Corfield, Brian Nicholls, Bernice Daly and ABC
results.brief_description: Alternative medicine offers us many options. Some approaches focus more on healthy body, others on healthy mind. But in all there is a common underlying theme, and that is that the individual can do a lot to keep themselves well. We don’t have to prop ourselves up with pills, or overload our bodies with junk food and stress. In this series, Nevill Drury takes us through a wide range of alternative therapies and treatments now available in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Corfield, Brian Nicholls, Bernice Daly and ABC

results.title: Forge and ornamental iron

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hand Operations-Metal Work”.
A description of the gas forge and its operation. Shows various tongs, parts of the anvil, and safety rules in forge operation.

results.title: The Ladies' man; Lord Byron lived here; The Lift
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hancock’s half hour”.
Three episodes from the British television comedy series “Hancock” starring Tony Hancock. 1. The Ladies man: Hancock decides to take things into his own hands and improve his success rate with the opposite sex. 2. Lord Byron lives here: The discovery of scribblings by the great poet Byron leads Hancock to open his house as a stately home, exploit the American tourists and make a fortune at the same time. The Lift: What a captive audience has top put up with when Hancock tips the balance of one too many in the lift and the lift won’t budge.

results.title: Instrumental program
results.creator_credit: F Whitman Trecartin, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Halifax Music”.
Displays some of the talents developed by students within the Halifax School Music Department system. From choral groups to jazz bands these youngsters have fun with their music and in so doing seem to involve their audiences in that enjoyment.

results.title: General music program
results.creator_credit: F Whitman Trecartin, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Halifax Music”.
Halifax Music is a documentary on the teaching methods of the Music Department of the Halifax School Board. Many of the basic concepts originated with the Hungarian composer Kodaly. Musical education is continuous from the primary grades through to Grade XII. The film tours the various classrooms, demonstrating methods and results, and shows how learning and enjoyment go hand in hand.

results.title: Putting yourself together
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Guidance for the 70’s”.
Two teenagers and counsellor Daniel Whiteside take a close look at how to think your way past the put-downs or problems that often weaken your self-image. The give-and-take between the three, draws us into the film and challenges us all to start taking control of this part of our lives.
